thread.title: Kronenwetter unveils filtration system to the public | News | waow.com
thread.title_full: Kronenwetter unveils filtration system to the public | News | waow.com

author: Cooper Wild
title: Kronenwetter unveils filtration system to the public | News | waow.com
text:
KRONENWETTER, Wis. (WAOW) - The Village of Kronenwetter held a ribbon cutting for their new water filtration system.
The event was open to anyone who wanted to attend. City officials showed everyone how it works. Along with having a taste test between raw water, and what it tastes like after the filter.
Public Works Director Greg Ulman said, "We are expecting quite a few people from the community to come, village board members, utility committees. Bunch of residents to come and really share the excitement with us."
After the ribbon was snipped, residents asked all kinds of questions to really understand how it works.
The system has been running for the Village since January 22nd. However this is the first time people were able to see it.
